intro: Parsonsia nudicostata, commonly known as the naked-costate parsonsia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a smooth, waxy texture. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its ecological role in its native habitat.
